title.narrative: IT Capacity Building in Port-au-Prince and Cité Soleil through HELP

description.narrative:
In Haiti, students have very limited access to computers let alone formal computer training. This leads to high school graduates who lack basic skills in typing, internet research, and operating such basic programs as Microsoft Office. Even the best Haitian universities have a very limited offering of equipment and training for students, leaving university graduates, and therefore educated professionals, without the most basic computer literacy skills.
The purpose of this project is to provide computer literacy to Haitian youth to help them succeed in school and prepare for the labor market. This project aims to address the following objectives:
Objective 1: Provide computer access and training to university students to supplement their technical skills Objective 2: Provide access and training to Haitian youth to improve computer literacy skills.
These objectives will be achieved through the following outputs:Updated computer lab installed at HELP increasing HELP’s capacity and improving computer access for university students; University students gain employable skills and gain thorough IT training and specialized open source programming training and develop a working app;Young students in underserved areas of Port-au-Prince receive increased access to technology and basic IT training from qualified university students.
The Principal Activities of this project include:
- 50 computers installed - HELP IT curriculum implemented for first and second year HELP students - HELP Computer Science students receive open source programming training and build a working mobile application. - HELP IT service project installs computers at partner
